intro: Avenula sulcata, commonly known as the sulcate sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Avenula sulcata typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and along water bodies. Its flowering spikes produce small, greenish or brownish flowers that are often clustered at the tips of the stems.
